page.title: 11LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: Ben Weston is Chairman of the{Parish {Council}and has been so for six years. The Council meets bi-monthly except in emergencies. Its main job,since{Local {Government Reorganisation in 1974,}is to maintain paths and highways, roadside verges, making planning application decisions. Governors are appointed to supervise different local organisations. Ben Weston has been Chairman of{Deerhurst School governors for eight years. The school has 86 pupils, 1 part-time and 3 full time teachers. The classes are five to six, seven to nine, and nine to eleven, when they transfer to the huge Tewkesbury Comprehensive School. The governors control the school fabric, curriculum, conduct of staff, appointment of new headmasters and consultation in the appointment of other staff.
